### Spy vs. spy: How GenAI is powering defenders and attackers


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article titled "Spy vs. Spy: How GenAI is Powering Defenders and Attackers" explores the dual-edged nature of generative artificial intelligence (GenAI) in cybersecurity. It highlights how GenAI technologies are increasingly being utilized by both cybercriminals and security experts. Attackers leverage GenAI to automate and enhance phishing attacks, generate convincing deepfakes, and deploy sophisticated malware, making cyber threats more formidable and harder to detect. Conversely, defenders employ GenAI to bolster threat

### React2Shell flaw exploited to breach 30 orgs, 77k IP addresses vulnerable


üõ°Ô∏è **SECURITY ALERT**


A critical vulnerability known as React2Shell has been exploited to compromise 30 organizations, impacting over 77,000 IP addresses worldwide. The flaw, which resides in certain web applications using the React framework, allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands remotely, leading to unauthorized access and potential data breaches. Cybersecurity experts have observed a surge in attacks leveraging this vulnerability, urging affected organizations to apply recommended patches and security updates immediately to mitigate risks. The incident highlights the importance of robust security practices in managing and updating web

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/react2shell-flaw-exploited-to-breach-30-orgs-77k-ip-addresses-vulnerable/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_8198)**

### SMS Phishers Pivot to Points, Taxes, Fake Retailers


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article discusses the evolving tactics of SMS phishing schemes, highlighting a shift towards targeting individuals with scams related to loyalty points, tax refunds, and fraudulent online retailers. Cybercriminals are increasingly using familiar themes that mimic legitimate sources, such as government agencies or popular retail brands, to lure victims into providing personal information or clicking on malicious links. The strategies involve sending text messages that prompt users to act quickly on seemingly urgent matters, such as redeeming points or addressing purported tax issues. The article underscores the importance

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://krebsonsecurity.com/2025/12/sms-phishers-pivot-to-points-taxes-fake-retailers/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_1760)**

### Documenting SME Processes with Conversational AI: From Tacit Knowledge to BPMN


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article discusses the utilization of conversational AI to document processes within small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), transforming tacit knowledge, which is often unrecorded and held by individual employees, into formalized Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN). It highlights the challenges SMEs face in process documentation due to limited resources and expertise. By leveraging conversational AI, SMEs can streamline the capture of this implicit knowledge through interactive dialogues that extract detailed process information from staff. This approach not only aids in preserving

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://arxiv.org/abs/2512.05122?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_871)**

### EU's New Digital Package Proposal Promises Red Tape Cuts but Guts GDPR Privacy Rights


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The European Union's proposed digital regulatory package aims to streamline processes and reduce bureaucratic hurdles for digital businesses. However, the proposal has sparked controversy as it potentially undermines the stringent privacy protections enshrined in the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Critics argue that the new measures could weaken data privacy rights by prioritizing business efficiency and innovation over individual privacy concerns. While the initiative seeks to foster a more dynamic digital market and enhance the EU‚Äôs competitive edge, it has raised alarms among privacy advocates who

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/12/eus-new-digital-package-proposal-promises-red-tape-cuts-guts-gdpr-privacy-rights?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_8497)**

### After Years of Controversy, the EU‚Äôs Chat Control Nears Its Final Hurdle: What to Know


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article discusses the European Union's impending decision on the controversial Chat Control legislation, which aims to regulate online communication platforms to detect and prevent child sexual abuse material (CSAM). This proposed law has sparked significant debate across Europe, highlighting a conflict between protecting children and preserving privacy rights. Opponents argue that the legislation could lead to mass surveillance and infringement on privacy, while proponents emphasize its necessity for child protection. As the EU nears a final resolution, the decision will have profound implications for both technology

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/12/after-years-controversy-eus-chat-control-nears-its-final-hurdle-what-know?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_9955)**

### How to build forward-thinking cybersecurity teams for tomorrow


üõ°Ô∏è **SECURITY ALERT**


To build forward-thinking cybersecurity teams, organizations must focus on a blend of diverse skills, continuous learning, and adaptive strategies to stay ahead of evolving threats. This involves recruiting individuals with varied backgrounds and expertise, fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation, and investing in ongoing training and development. Emphasizing a proactive approach to threat detection and response, teams should leverage advanced technologies like artificial intelligence and machine learning. Additionally, strong leadership and cross-departmental communication are crucial to enable swift decision-making and integrate cybersecurity

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2025/12/02/how-to-build-forward-thinking-cybersecurity-teams-for-tomorrow/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_6852)**
